WorkItem.Description:
I have a simple expression defined as

10+10/2

and would expect the result equalling 10, however I am getting 15 because. I can resolve the issue by bracketing the (10 + 10) / 2 but ideally I don't want to use bracketing. 

Is there any way around this please

Comments.Message:
I am unsure what you are hoping for. The order of precedence is well documented and doesn't just apply to programming - it is the same across all mathematics.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_operations

The only way to change this behavior is to use parenthesis to indicate that the order should be different.

My mistake, I was comparing the results you get when using a calculator but then I realised that there is a difference between evaluating an expression as a whole compared to how a calculator would work it out based on 10 + 10 being worked out first.
